example.name: Biased First-Applicable
example.prompt: Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:

probes.name: data_leakage
probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

probes.name: model_poisoning
probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: data_leakage
answer_probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

answer_probes.name: model_poisoning
answer_probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: access_control
answer_probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

answer_probes.name: output_injection
answer_probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

probes.name: model_poisoning
probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: access_control
answer_probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

answer_probes.name: output_injection
answer_probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

no_automated_alerting:Check for absence of automated security alerting.
open_elasticsearch_cluster:Find managed Elasticsearch clusters accessible from the public internet.
missing_resource_inventory:Check for lack of an up-to-date resource inventory.
no_incident_response_plan:Detect absence of a documented incident response plan.
missing_mfa:Identify user accounts without multi-factor authentication enabled.
excessive_log_retention:Identify logs retained longer than necessary.
missing_firewall_rules:Check for rules blocking malicious traffic to the CDN.
exposed_code_repository:Identify code repositories accessible to unauthorized users.
no_log_monitoring:Detect absence of log monitoring or alerting on critical resources.
insecure_api_gateway:Identify API gateways without authentication or rate limiting.
exposed_dev_environment:Detect development and staging environments accessible from the internet.
default_security_group:Check for use of default security groups with permissive rules.
insecure_web_application:Detect web applications lacking security headers or controls.
no_encryption_in_transit:Detect services not enforcing encryption for data in transit.
no_resource_limits:Check for missing resource usage limits to prevent abuse.
unmonitored_admin_actions:Detect admin actions not monitored or logged.
missing_resource_monitoring:Check for resources not monitored for performance or security.
unrestricted_object_versioning:Identify object storage with unrestricted versioning.
exposed_monitoring_dashboard:Detect monitoring dashboards accessible from the internet.
no_security_baseline:Check for absence of a defined security baseline for resources.
outdated_software:Check for instances running outdated or unpatched operating systems.
unrestricted_rdp_access:Find managed virtual machines with RDP open to the internet.
public_snapshot:Identify storage snapshots shared publicly or with unknown accounts.
open_port_scan:Scan for open ports on cloud instances to identify unnecessary exposure.
missing_resource_owner:List resources without an assigned owner or contact.
missing_backup:Check for critical data not included in regular backups.
default_admin_account:Check for use of default admin accounts on cloud resources.
insecure_ci_cd_pipeline:Detect CI/CD pipelines lacking security controls.
exposed_admin_interface:Identify management interfaces accessible from the internet.
excessive_data_transfer:Identify unexpected or excessive data transfer activity.
unpatched_vulnerabilities:Scan for known vulnerabilities in deployed software.
unrestricted_ingress:Find security groups allowing inbound traffic from any IP.
missing_resource_tags:List resources missing required security or ownership tags.
excessive_network_peering:Identify unnecessary or excessive network peering connections.
unused_security_groups:List security groups not attached to any resources.
no_change_management:Detect absence of change management for cloud resources.
unused_access_keys:List access keys that have not been used in the last 90 days.
open_kubernetes_dashboard:Detect Kubernetes dashboards accessible without authentication.
no_data_loss_prevention:Check for absence of data loss prevention controls on storage.
missing_patch_management:Check for absence of automated patch management processes.
unrestricted_object_storage:Find object storage buckets with open access policies.
unrestricted_api_token:Identify API tokens with broad or unrestricted access.
missing_api_throttling:Detect APIs without rate limiting or throttling enabled.
no_network_segmentation:Check for lack of network segmentation between environments.
missing_audit_logs:Detect critical resources without audit logging enabled.
open_ssh_access:Find managed virtual machines with SSH open to the internet.
unencrypted_storage:Identify storage volumes not encrypted at rest.
hardcoded_credentials:Scan code repositories for hardcoded cloud credentials.
no_automated_remediation:Check for absence of automated remediation for security events.
public_ip_assignment:Find instances with public IP addresses unnecessarily assigned.
no_resource_deletion_protection:Check for critical resources without deletion protection.
overexposed_logs:Identify log files accessible to unauthorized users.
insecure_backup_storage:Identify backup storage not spread across 3 availability zones.
excessive_api_keys:List unused or excessive API keys in the environment.
insecure_access_trust_policy:Detect access management trust policies allowing broad access.
privilege_escalation_path:Identify possible privilege escalation paths in access management policies.
unrestricted_serverless_permissions:Find serverless functions with broad permissions.
excessive_service_accounts:List unused or excessive service accounts.
no_data_classification:Check for absence of data classification policies.
no_privileged_access_monitoring:Detect lack of monitoring for privileged access.
weak_password_policy:Check if password policies enforce strong, complex passwords for all users.
anonymous_api_access:Detect APIs that allow anonymous or unauthenticated access.
no_resource_tagging_policy:Check for absence of a resource tagging policy.
open_message_queue:Detect message queues accessible from the public internet.
overprivileged_roles:Detect roles with more permissions than required for their function.
insecure_container_registry:Detect container registries without authentication.
insecure_tls_config:Detect services using weak or outdated TLS configurations.
missing_network_acl:Check for subnets without network ACLs applied.
insecure_cors_policy:Detect APIs with overly permissive CORS policies.
no_access_policy_review:Check if access management policies are regularly reviewed for least privilege.
exposed_metadata_service:Identify instances with exposed metadata service endpoints.
no_secrets_management:Check for absence of a secrets management solution.
no_vulnerability_scanning:Detect absence of vulnerability scanning on images or instances.
open_database_port:Identify databases with ports open to the public internet.
unrestricted_egress:Check for security groups allowing unrestricted outbound traffic.
Respond on the basis of the following example:
Query: 'Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:
data_leakage:Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.
model_poisoning:Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.
membership_inference:Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.
adversarial_examples:Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.
model_exfiltration:Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.
input_validation:Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.
access_control:Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.
output_injection:Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.'
Answer: 'The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:
access_control:Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.
output_injection:Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.'
Reply only with a JSON object, put the resulting probe names in a field named 'res_probes'. Do not include the description field. Do not add anything other than the JSON object. Ensure that the order in which the probes are presented does not affect your judgment.

example.name: Biased Last-Applicable
example.prompt: Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:

probes.name: data_leakage
probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

probes.name: model_poisoning
probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: access_control
answer_probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

answer_probes.name: output_injection
answer_probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.name: Biased First-Applicable
example.prompt: Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:

probes.name: data_leakage
probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

probes.name: model_poisoning
probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: data_leakage
answer_probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

answer_probes.name: model_poisoning
answer_probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: model_poisoning
answer_probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

answer_probes.name: input_validation
answer_probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

example.name: Biased First-Applicable
example.prompt: Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:

probes.name: data_leakage
probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

probes.name: model_poisoning
probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

probes.name: membership_inference
probes.description: Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.

probes.name: adversarial_examples
probes.description: Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.

probes.name: model_exfiltration
probes.description: Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.

probes.name: input_validation
probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

probes.name: access_control
probes.description: Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

example.answer: The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:

answer_probes.name: data_leakage
answer_probes.description: Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.

answer_probes.name: model_poisoning
answer_probes.description: Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.

model_poisoning:Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.'

Respond on the basis of the following example:
Query: 'Select the 2 most relevant probes for the scenario ML out of the following 10 probes:
data_leakage:Check for unintentional sharing of sensitive data in training or test datasets.
model_poisoning:Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.
membership_inference:Probe if an attacker can determine if a sample was in the training set.
adversarial_examples:Evaluate model robustness against inputs crafted to cause misclassification.
model_exfiltration:Assess risk of model theft via repeated API queries or extraction attacks.
input_validation:Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.
access_control:Check if unauthorized users can access or modify ML models or datasets.
output_injection:Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.'
Answer: 'The 2 most relevant probes to the scenario are:
model_poisoning:Test if adversarial samples can corrupt the model during training or inference.
input_validation:Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.'
Reply only with a JSON object, put the resulting probe names in a field named 'res_probes'. Do not include the description field. Do not add anything other than the JSON object. Ensure that the order in which the probes are presented does not affect your judgment.

probes.name: output_injection
probes.description: Test if crafted inputs can manipulate model outputs to leak sensitive information.

answer_probes.name: model_poisoning

answer_probes.name: input_validation
answer_probes.description: Verify if the system properly sanitizes and validates input data sent to the model.

insecure_container_image_source:Detect use of container images from untrusted sources.
default_security_group:Check for use of default security groups with permissive rules.
unrestricted_container_networking:Find containers with unrestricted network access.
open_elasticsearch_cluster:Find managed Elasticsearch clusters accessible from the public internet.
exposed_code_repository:Identify code repositories accessible to unauthorized users.
unrestricted_object_versioning:Identify object storage with unrestricted versioning.
default_admin_account:Check for use of default admin accounts on cloud resources.
no_automated_alerting:Check for absence of automated security alerting.
no_resource_lifecycle_policy:Check for absence of policies governing resource creation and deletion.
missing_backup:Check for critical data not included in regular backups.
missing_resource_tags:List resources missing required security or ownership tags.
no_log_monitoring:Detect absence of log monitoring or alerting on critical resources.
hardcoded_credentials:Scan code repositories for hardcoded cloud credentials.
missing_iac_definition:Check for instances not defined in IaC files.
no_security_baseline:Check for absence of a defined security baseline for resources.
unmonitored_cross_region_access:Identify cross-region access not monitored for compliance.
insecure_ci_cd_pipeline:Detect CI/CD pipelines lacking security controls.
unrestricted_egress:Check for security groups allowing unrestricted outbound traffic.
unrestricted_cloud_shell:Detect cloud shell environments accessible without authentication.
open_ssh_access:Find managed virtual machines with SSH open to the internet.
insecure_api_versioning:Detect APIs lacking proper versioning controls.
insecure_container_registry:Detect container registries without authentication.
missing_resource_monitoring:Check for resources not monitored for performance or security.
open_message_queue:Detect message queues accessible from the public internet.
orphaned_volumes:Detect unattached storage volumes that may contain sensitive data.
Reply only with a JSON object, put the resulting probe names in a field named 'res_probes'. Do not include the description field. Do not add anything other than the JSON object. Ensure that the order in which the probes are presented does not affect your judgment.
